summary.long: Luke is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Since many have attempted to compile an account concerning the events that have been fulfilled among us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: just as those who were eyewitnesses and servants of the word from the beginning passed on to us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: it seemed best to me also—because I have followed all things carefully from the beginning—to write them down in orderly sequence for you, most excellent Theophilus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that you may know the certainty concerning the things about which you were taught.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It happened that in the days of Herod, king of Judea, there was a certain priest, Zechariah by name, of the division of Abijah. And he had a wife from the daughters of Aaron, and her name was Elizabeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were both righteous in the sight of God, living blamelessly in all the commandments and regulations of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they did not have a child, because Elizabeth was barren. And they were both advanced in years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that while he was serving as priest before God in the order of his division,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: according to the custom of the priesthood he was chosen by lot to enter into the temple of the Lord to burn incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the whole crowd of the people were praying outside at the hour of the incense offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And an angel of the Lord appeared to him, standing at the right side of the altar of incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Zechariah was terrified when he saw the angel, and fear fell upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the angel said to him,
“Do not be afraid, Zechariah,
because your prayer has been heard,
and your wife Elizabeth will bear you a son,
and you will call his name John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And you will experience joy and exultation,
and many will rejoice at his birth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he will be great in the sight of the Lord,
and he must never drink wine or beer,
and he will be filled with the Holy Spirit
    while he is still in his mother’s womb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he will turn many of the sons of Israel
    to the Lord their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he will go on before him
    in the spirit and power of Elijah,
to turn the hearts of the fathers to the children,
and the disobedient to the wisdom of the righteous,
    to prepare for the Lord a people made ready.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Zechariah said to the angel, “By what will I know this? For I am an old man, and my wife is advanced in years!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the angel answered and said to him, “I am Gabriel, who stands in the presence of God, and I was sent to speak to you and to announce to you this good news.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, you will be silent and not able to speak until the day these things take place, because you did not believe my words, which will be fulfilled in their time.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people were waiting for Zechariah, and began to wonder when he was delayed in the temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he came out he was not able to speak to them, and they realized that he had seen a vision in the temple. And he kept making signs to them, and remained unable to speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that when the days of his service came to an end, he went away to his home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now after these days, his wife Elizabeth conceived, and she kept herself in seclusion for five months, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus the Lord has done for me in the days in which he has concerned himself with me, to take away my disgrace among people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the sixth month, the angel Gabriel was sent from God to a town of Galilee named Nazareth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to a virgin legally promised in marriage to a man named Joseph of the house of David. And the name of the virgin was Mary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came to her and said, “Greetings, favored one! The Lord is with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But she was greatly perplexed at the statement, and was pondering what sort of greeting this might be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And the angel said to her,
“Do not be afraid, Mary, for you have found favor with God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
And behold, you will conceive in the womb and will give birth to a son,
    and you will call his name Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This one will be great, and he will be called the Son of the Most High,
    and the Lord God will give him the throne of his father David.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
And he will reign over the house of Jacob forever,
    and of his kingdom there will be no end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Mary said to the angel, “How will this be, since I have not had sexual relations with a man?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And the angel answered and said to her,
“The Holy Spirit will come upon you,
    and the power of the Most High will overshadow you.
Therefore also the one to be born will be called holy, the Son of God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And behold, your relative Elizabeth—she also has conceived a son in her old age, and this is the sixth month for her who was called barren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For nothing will be impossible with God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Mary said, “Behold, the Lord’s female slave! May it happen to me according to your word.” And the angel departed from her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in those days Mary set out and traveled with haste into the hill country, to a town of Judah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and entered into the house of Zechariah, and greeted Elizabeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that when Elizabeth heard the greeting of Mary, the baby in her womb leaped and Elizabeth was filled with the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And she cried out with a loud shout and said,
“Blessed are you among women,
    and blessed is the fruit of your womb!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And why is this granted to me, that the mother of my Lord should come to me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For behold, when the sound of your greeting came to my ears, the baby in my womb leaped for joy!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And blessed is she who believed that there will be a fulfillment to what was spoken to her from the Lord!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And Mary said,
“My soul exalts the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and my spirit has rejoiced greatly in God my Savior,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because he has looked upon the humble state of his female slave,
    for behold, from now on all generations will consider me blessed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because the Mighty One has done great things for me,
    and holy is his name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And his mercy is for generation after generation
    to those who fear him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has done a mighty deed with his arm;
    he has dispersed the proud in the thoughts of their hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has brought down rulers from their thrones,
    and has exalted the lowly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has filled those who are hungry with good things,
    and those who are rich he has sent away empty-handed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has helped Israel his servant,
    remembering his mercy,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
just as he spoke to our fathers,
    to Abraham and to his descendants forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Mary stayed with her about three months, and returned to her home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the time came for Elizabeth that she should give birth, and she gave birth to a son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And her neighbors and relatives heard that the Lord had shown his great mercy to her, and they rejoiced with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that on the eighth day they came to circumcise the child, and they were wanting to name him after his father Zechariah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his mother answered and said, “No, but he will be named John.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said to her, “There is no one of your relatives who is called by this name.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they made signs to his father asking what he wanted him to be named,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he asked for a writing tablet and wrote, saying, “John is his name.” And they were all astonished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his mouth and his tongue were opened immediately, and he began to speak, praising God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And fear came on all those who lived near them, and in all the hill country of Judea all these events were discussed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all those who heard kept these things in their hearts, saying, “What then will this child be? For indeed the hand of the Lord was with him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his father Zechariah was filled with the Holy Spirit and prophesied, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel,
    because he has visited to help and has redeemed his people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and has raised up a horn of salvation for us
    in the house of his servant David,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: just as he spoke through the mouth of his holy prophets from earliest times—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: salvation from our enemies and from the hand of all those who hate us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to show mercy to our fathers
    and to remember his holy covenant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the oath that he swore to Abraham our father,
    to grant us
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that we, being rescued from the hand of our enemies,
could serve him without fear
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
in holiness and righteousness
    before him all our days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And so you, child, will be called the prophet of the Most High,
    for you will go on before the Lord to prepare his ways,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to give knowledge of salvation to his people
    by the forgiveness of their sins,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because of the merciful compassion of our God
    by which the dawn will visit to help us from on high,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to give light to those who sit in darkness and in the shadow of death,
    to direct our feet into the way of peace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the child kept growing and becoming strong in spirit, and was in the wilderness until the day of his public appearance to Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it happened that in those days a decree went out from Caesar Augustus to register all the empire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (This first registration took place when Quirinius was governor of Syria.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And everyone went to be registered, each one to his own town.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joseph also went up from Galilee, from the town of Nazareth, to Judea, to the city of David which is called Bethlehem, because he was of the house and family line of David,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to be registered together with Mary, who was legally promised in marriage to him and was pregnant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that while they were there, the time came for her to give birth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she gave birth to her firstborn son, and wrapped him in strips of cloth and laid him in a manger, because there was no place for them in the inn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there were shepherds in the same region, living out of doors and keeping watch, guarding over their flock by night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And an angel of the Lord stood near them, and the glory of the Lord shone around them, and they were terribly frightened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the angel said to them, “Do not be afraid, for behold, I bring good news to you of great joy which will be for all the people:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that today a Savior, who is Christ the Lord, was born for you in the city of David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this will be the sign for you: you will find the baby wrapped in strips of cloth and lying in a manger.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And suddenly there was with the angel a multitude of the heavenly army, praising God and saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Glory to God in the highest,
    and on earth peace
    among people with whom he is pleased!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that when the angels had departed from them into heaven, the shepherds began to say to one another, “Let us go now to Bethlehem and see this thing that has happened, which the Lord has revealed to us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they went hurrying and found both Mary and Joseph, and the baby who was lying in the manger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they saw it, they made known the statement that had been told to them about this child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all who heard it were astonished concerning what had been said to them by the shepherds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Mary treasured up all these words, pondering them in her heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the shepherds returned, glorifying and praising God for all that they had heard and seen, just as it had been told to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when eight days were completed so that he could be circumcised, he was named Jesus, his name that he was called by the angel before he was conceived in the womb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the days of their purification were completed according to the law of Moses, they brought him up to Jerusalem to present him to the Lord
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (just as it is written in the law of the Lord, “Every male that opens the womb will be called holy to the Lord”)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to offer a sacrifice according to what was stated in the law of the Lord, “a pair of turtledoves or two young pigeons.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, there was a man in Jerusalem whose name was Simeon, and this man was righteous and devout, looking forward to the consolation of Israel, and the Holy Spirit was upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it had been revealed to him by the Holy Spirit that he would not see death before he would see the Lord’s Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came in the Spirit into the temple, and when the parents brought in the child Jesus so that they could do for him according to what was customary under the law,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he took him in his arms and praised God and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Now dismiss your slave in peace, Lord,
    according to your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For my eyes have seen your salvation
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that you have prepared in the presence of all the peoples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
a light for revelation to the Gentiles,
    and glory to your people Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his father and mother were astonished at what was said about him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Simeon blessed them and said to his mother Mary, “Behold, this child is appointed for the fall and rise of many in Israel, and for a sign that is opposed—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a sword will pierce your own soul also, so that the thoughts of many hearts will be revealed!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was a prophetess, Anna the daughter of Phanuel of the tribe of Asher (she was advanced in years, having lived with her husband seven years after her marriage,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and herself as a widow up to eighty-four years) who did not depart from the temple with fastings and prayers, serving night and day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And at that same hour she approached and began to give thanks to God, and to speak about him to all those who were waiting for the redemption of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had completed everything according to the law of the Lord, they returned to Galilee, to their own town of Nazareth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the child was growing and becoming strong, filled with wisdom, and the favor of God was upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his parents went every year to Jerusalem for the feast of the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he was twelve years old, they went up according to the custom of the feast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after the days were completed, while they were returning, the boy Jesus stayed behind in Jerusalem. And his parents did not know it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but believing him to be in the group of travelers, they went a day’s journey. And they began searching for him among their relatives and their acquaintances,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when they did not find him, they returned to Jerusalem to search for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that after three days they found him in the temple courts, sitting in the midst of the teachers and listening to them and asking them questions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all who heard him were amazed at his insight and his answers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they saw him, they were astounded and his mother said to him, “Child, why have you done this to us? Look, your father and I have been searching for you anxiously!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Why were you searching for me? Did you not know that it was necessary for me to be in the house of my Father?”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And they did not understand the statement that he spoke to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went down with them and came to Nazareth, and was submitting to them. And his mother treasured all these things in her heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus was advancing in wisdom and stature and in favor with God and with people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar, when Pontius Pilate was governor of Judea, and Herod was tetrarch of Galilee, and his brother Philip was tetrarch of the region of Iturea and Trachonitis, and Lysanias was tetrarch of Abilene,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in the time of the high priest Annas and Caiaphas, the word of God came to John the son of Zechariah in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went into all the surrounding region of the Jordan, preaching a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
as it is written in the book of the words of the prophet Isaiah,
“The voice of one crying out in the wilderness,
‘Prepare the way of the Lord,
    make his paths straight!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Every valley will be filled,
    and every mountain and hill will be leveled,
and the crooked will become straight,
    and the rough road will become smooth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all flesh will see the salvation of God.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore he was saying to the crowds that came out to be baptized by him, “Offspring of vipers! Who warned you to flee from the coming wrath?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore produce fruit worthy of repentance! And do not begin to say to yourselves, ‘We have Abraham as father.’ For I say to you that God is able to raise up children for Abraham from these stones!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And even now the ax is positioned at the root of the trees; therefore every tree not producing good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the crowds were asking him, saying, “What then should we do?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answered and said to them, “The one who has two tunics must share with the one who does not have one, and the one who has food must do likewise.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And tax collectors also came to be baptized, and they said to him, “Teacher, what should we do?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Collect no more than what you are ordered to.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those who served in the army were also asking him, saying, “What should we also do?” And he said to them, “Extort from no one, and do not blackmail anyone, and be content with your pay.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while the people were waiting expectantly and all were pondering in their hearts concerning John, whether perhaps he might be the Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John answered them all, saying, “I baptize you with water, but the one who is more powerful than I am is coming, of whom I am not worthy to untie the strap of his sandals. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His winnowing shovel is in his hand, to clean out his threshing floor and to gather the wheat into his storehouse, but he will burn up the chaff with unquenchable fire.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So with many other exhortations also he proclaimed good news to the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Herod the tetrarch, who had been reproved by him concerning Herodias, his brother’s wife, and concerning all the evil deeds that Herod had done,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: added this also to them all: he also locked up John in prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it happened that when all the people were baptized, Jesus also was baptized, and while he was praying, heaven was opened,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Holy Spirit descended on him in bodily form like a dove, and a voice came from heaven, “You are my beloved Son; with you I am well pleased.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus, when he began his ministry, was himself about thirty years old, being the son (as it was believed) of Joseph the son of Eli,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Matthat, the son of Levi, the son of Melchi, the son of Jannai, the son of Joseph,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Mattathias, the son of Amos, the son of Nahum, the son of Esli, the son of Naggai,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Maath, the son of Mattathias, the son of Semein, the son of Josech, the son of Joda,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Joanan, the son of Rhesa, the son of Zerubbabel, the son of Shealtiel, the son of Neri,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Melchi, the son of Addi, the son of Cosam, the son of Elmadam, the son of Er,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Joshua, the son of Eliezer, the son of Jorim, the son of Matthat, the son of Levi,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Simeon, the son of Judah, the son of Joseph, the son of Jonam, the son of Eliakim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Melea, the son of Menna, the son of Mattatha, the son of Nathan, the son of David,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Jesse, the son of Obed, the son of Boaz, the son of Sala, the son of Nahshon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Amminadab, the son of Admin, the son of Arni, the son of Hezron, the son of Perez, the son of Judah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Jacob, the son of Isaac, the son of Abraham, the son of Terah, the son of Nahor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Serug, the son of Reu, the son of Peleg, the son of Eber, the son of Shelah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Cainan, the son of Arphaxad, the son of Shem, the son of Noah, the son of Lamech,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Methuselah, the son of Enoch, the son of Jared, the son of Mahalaleel, the son of Cainan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Enosh, the son of Seth, the son of Adam, the son of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus, full of the Holy Spirit, returned from the Jordan and was led by the Spirit in the wilderness
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: forty days, being tempted by the devil. And he ate nothing during those days, and when they were completed, he was hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the devil said to him, “If you are the Son of God, order this stone that it become bread!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus replied to him, “It is written, ‘Man will not live on bread alone.’”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And he led him up and showed him all the kingdoms of the world in a moment of time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the devil said to him, “I will give you all this domain and their glory, because it has been handed over to me, and I can give it to whomever I want.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So if you will worship before me, all this will be yours.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered and said to him, “It is written, ‘You shall worship the Lord your God, and serve only him.’”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And he brought him to Jerusalem, and had him stand on the highest point of the temple and said to him, “If you are the Son of God, throw yourself down from here,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
and
‘on their hands they will lift you up,
    lest you strike your foot against a stone.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered and said to him, “It is said, ‘You are not to put to the test the Lord your God.’”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And when the devil had completed every temptation, he departed from him until a favorable time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus returned in the power of the Spirit to Galilee, and news about him went out throughout all the surrounding region.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he began to teach in their synagogues, and was praised by all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came to Nazareth, where he had been brought up, and according to his custom he entered into the synagogue on the day of the Sabbath and stood up to read.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the scroll of the prophet Isaiah was given to him, and unrolling the scroll he found the place where it was written,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The Spirit of the Lord is upon me,
    because of which he has anointed me
to proclaim good news to the poor.
    He has sent me
to proclaim release to the captives,
    and recovery of sight to the blind,
to send out in freedom those who are oppressed,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: to proclaim the favorable year of the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he rolled up the scroll and gave it back to the attendant and sat down. And the eyes of everyone in the synagogue were looking intently at him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he began to say to them, “Today this scripture has been fulfilled in your hearing.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And they were all speaking well of him, and were astonished at the gracious words that were coming out of his mouth. And they were saying, “Is this man not the son of Joseph?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Doubtless you will tell me this parable: ‘Physician, heal yourself!’ Whatever we have heard that took place in Capernaum, do here in your hometown also!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And he said, “Truly I say to you that no prophet is acceptable in his own hometown.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But in truth I say to you, there were many widows in Israel in the days of Elijah, when the sky was shut for three years and six months while a great famine took place over all the land.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And Elijah was sent to none of them, but only to Zarephath in the region of Sidon, to a woman who was a widow.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And there were many lepers in Israel in the time of the prophet Elisha, and none of them was made clean except Naaman the Syrian.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And all those in the synagogue were filled with anger when they heard these things.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And they stood up and forced him out of the town and brought him up to the edge of the hill on which their town was built, so that they could throw him down the cliff.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he passed through their midst and went on his way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came down to Capernaum, a town of Galilee, and was teaching them on the Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were astounded at his teaching, because he spoke with authority.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the synagogue there was a man who had the spirit of an unclean demon, and he cried out with a loud voice,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Ha! Leave us alone, Jesus the Nazarene! Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are—the Holy One of God!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And Jesus rebuked him, saying, “Be silent and come out of him!” And after throwing him down in their midst, the demon came out of him without hurting him at all.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And amazement came upon them all, and they began to talk with one another, saying, “What word is this? For he commands the unclean spirits with authority and power, and they come out!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And news about him went out into every place of the surrounding region.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after he set out from the synagogue, he went into Simon’s house. And Simon’s mother-in-law was afflicted with a high fever, and they asked him on behalf of her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he stood over her and rebuked the fever, and it left her. And immediately she got up and began to serve them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as the sun was setting, all who had those who were sick with various diseases brought them to him, and placing his hands on every one of them, he healed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And demons also were coming out of many, crying out and saying, “You are the Son of God!” And he rebuked them and did not permit them to speak, because they knew that he was the Christ.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And when it was day, he departed and went to an isolated place. And the crowds were seeking him, and came to him and were trying to prevent him from departing from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said to them, “It is necessary for me to proclaim the good news of the kingdom of God to the other towns also, because I was sent for this purpose.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And he was preaching in the synagogues of Judea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it happened that while the crowd was pressing around him and hearing the word of God, he was standing beside the lake of Gennesaret,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he saw two boats there beside the lake, but the fishermen had gotten out of them and were washing their nets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he got into one of the boats, which was Simon’s, and asked him to put out from the land a little. And he sat down and began to teach the crowds from the boat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he stopped speaking, he said to Simon, “Put out into the deep water and let down your nets for a catch.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Simon answered and said, “Master, although we worked hard through the whole night, we caught nothing. But at your word I will let down the nets.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they did this, they caught a very large number of fish, and their nets began to tear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they signaled to their partners in the other boat to come and help them, and they came and filled both the boats so that they began to sink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he saw it, Simon Peter fell down at Jesus’ knees, saying, “Depart from me, Lord, because I am a sinful man!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For amazement had seized him and all those who were with him at the catch of fish that they had caught,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and so also were James and John, the sons of Zebedee, who were business partners with Simon. And Jesus said to Simon, “Do not be afraid! From now on you will be catching people!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after they brought their boats to the land, they left everything and followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that while he was in one of the towns, there was a man covered with leprosy. And when he saw Jesus, he fell down on his face and begged him, saying, “Lord, if you are willing, you are able to make me clean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And extending his hand he touched him, saying, “I am willing; be clean.” And immediately the leprosy went away from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he ordered him, “Tell no one, but go and show yourself to the priest and bring the offering for your cleansing just as Moses commanded, for a testimony to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the report about him spread even more, and large crowds were gathering to hear him and to be healed of their illnesses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he himself was withdrawing in the wilderness and praying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that on one of the days as he was teaching, Pharisees and teachers of the law were sitting there who had come from every village of Galilee and Judea and from Jerusalem, and the power of the Lord was there in order for him to heal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, men came carrying on a stretcher a man who was paralyzed, and they were seeking to bring him in and place him before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they did not find a way to bring him in because of the crowd, they went up on the roof and let him down through the roof tiles with the stretcher into the midst of them, in front of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he saw their faith, he said, “Friend, your sins are forgiven you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the scribes and the Pharisees began to reason, saying, “Who is this man who speaks blasphemies? Who is able to forgive sins except God alone?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus, perceiving their thoughts, answered and said to them, “Why are you reasoning in your hearts?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which is easier to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven you,’ or to say, ‘Get up and walk?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But in order that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins,” he said to the one who was paralyzed, “I say to you, ‘Get up and pick up your stretcher and go to your home.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately he stood up before them, picked up what he had been lying on, and went away to his home, glorifying God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And amazement seized them all, and they began to glorify God. And they were filled with fear, saying, “We have seen wonderful things today!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after these things, he went out and saw a tax collector named Levi sitting at the tax booth, and he said to him, “Follow me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And leaving everything behind, he got up and began to follow him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Levi gave a great banquet for him in his house, and there was a large crowd of tax collectors and others who were reclining for the meal with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Pharisees and their scribes began to complain to his disciples, saying, “Why do you eat and drink with the tax collectors and sinners?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered and said to them, “Those who are healthy do not have need of a physician, but those who are sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have not come to call the righteous but sinners to repentance.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said to him, “The disciples of John fast often and make prayers—likewise also the disciples of the Pharisees—but yours are eating and drinking!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said to them, “You are not able to make the bridegroom’s attendants fast as long as the bridegroom is with them, are you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But days will come, and when the bridegroom is taken away from them, then they will fast in those days.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he also told a parable to them: “No one tears a patch from a new garment and puts it on an old garment. Otherwise, he will have torn the new also, and the old will not match the patch that is from the new.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And no one pours new wine into old wineskins. Otherwise, the new wine will burst the wineskins, and it will be spilled and the wineskins will be destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But new wine must be put into new wineskins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And no one after drinking old wine wants new, because he says, ‘The old is just fine!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it happened that on a Sabbath he went through the grain fields, and his disciples were picking and eating the heads of grain, rubbing them in their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some of the Pharisees said, “Why are you doing what is not permitted on the Sabbath?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered and said to them, “Have you not read this, what David did when he and those who were with him were hungry—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: how he entered into the house of God and took the bread of the presentation, which it is not permitted to eat (except the priests alone), and ate it and gave it to those with him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “The Son of Man is Lord of the Sabbath.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it happened that on another Sabbath he entered into the synagogue and was teaching, and a man was there, and his right hand was withered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the scribes and the Pharisees were watching closely to see if he would heal on the Sabbath, in order that they could find a reason to accuse him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he knew their thoughts and said to the man who had the withered hand, “Get up and stand in the middle,” and he got up and stood there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to them, “I ask you whether it is permitted on the Sabbath to do good or to do evil, to save a life or to destroy it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after looking around at them all, he said to him, “Stretch out your hand,” and he did, and his hand was restored.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they were filled with fury, and began discussing with one another what they might do to Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it happened that in these days he went away to the mountain to pray, and was spending the whole night in prayer to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when day came, he summoned his disciples and chose from them twelve, whom he also named apostles:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon (whom he also named Peter) and his brother Andrew, and James, and John, and Philip, and Bartholomew,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Matthew, and Thomas, and James the son of Alphaeus, and Simon who was called the Zealot,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Judas the son of James, and Judas Iscariot, who became a traitor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came down with them and stood on a level place, and a large crowd of his disciples and a great multitude of people from all of Judea and Jerusalem and the seacoast district of Tyre and Sidon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who came to hear him and to be healed of their diseases, and those who were troubled by unclean spirits were cured.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the whole crowd was seeking to touch him, because power was going out from him and healing them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he lifted up his eyes to his disciples and said,
“Blessed are the poor,
    because yours is the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed are those who are hungry now,
    because you will be satisfied.
Blessed are those who weep now,
    Because you will laugh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed are you when people hate you, and when they exclude you and revile you and spurn your name as evil on account of the Son of Man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rejoice in that day, and leap for joy, for behold, your reward is great in heaven. For their fathers used to do the same things to the prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But woe to you who are rich,
    because you have received your comfort.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Woe to you who are satisfied now,
    because you will be hungry.
Woe, you who laugh now,
    because you will mourn and weep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Woe whenever all people speak well of you,
    for their fathers used to do the same things to the false prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But to you who are listening I say: Love your enemies, do good to those who hate you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: bless those who curse you, pray for those who mistreat you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the one who strikes you on the cheek, offer the other also, and from the one who takes away your cloak, do not withhold your tunic also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give to everyone who asks you, and from the one who takes away your things, do not ask for them back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And just as you want people to do to you, do the same to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And if you love those who love you, what kind of credit is that to you? For even sinners love those who love them!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if you do good to those who do good to you, what kind of credit is that to you? Even the sinners do the same!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if you lend to those from whom you expect to receive back, what kind of credit is that to you? Even sinners lend to sinners, so that they may get back an equal amount!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But love your enemies, and do good, and lend expecting back nothing, and your reward will be great, and you will be sons of the Most High, because he is kind to the ungrateful and wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be merciful, just as your Father is merciful!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And do not judge, and you will never be judged. And do not condemn, and you will never be condemned. Pardon, and you will be pardoned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give, and it will be given to you, a good measure—pressed down, shaken, overflowing—they will pour out into your lap. For with the measure by which you measure out, it will be measured out to you in return.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he also told them a parable: “Surely a blind person cannot lead the blind, can he? Will they not both fall into a pit?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A disciple is not superior to his teacher, but everyone, when he is fully trained, will be like his teacher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And why do you see the speck that is in your brother’s eye, but do not notice the beam of wood that is in your own eye?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How are you able to say to your brother, “Brother, allow me to remove the speck that is in your eye,” while you yourself do not see the beam of wood in your own eye? Hypocrite! First remove the beam of wood from your own eye, and then you will see clearly to remove the speck that is in your brother’s eye!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For there is no good tree that produces bad fruit, nor on the other hand a bad tree that produces good fruit,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for each tree is known by its own fruit. For figs are not gathered from thorn plants, nor are grapes harvested from thorn bushes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The good person out of the good treasury of his heart brings forth good, and the evil person out of his evil treasury brings forth evil. For out of the abundance of the heart his mouth speaks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And why do you call me ‘Lord, Lord,’ and do not do what I tell you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Everyone who comes to me and listens to my words and does them—I will show you what he is like:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he is like a man building a house, who dug and went down deep and laid the foundation on the rock. And when a flood came, the river burst against that house and was not able to shake it, because it had been built well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the one who hears my words and does not do them is like a man who built a house on the ground without a foundation, which the river burst against, and immediately it collapsed—and the collapse of that house was great!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After he had finished all his statements in the hearing of the people, he entered into Capernaum.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a certain centurion’s slave, who was esteemed by him, was sick and was about to die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when he heard about Jesus, he sent Jewish elders to him, asking him that he would come and cure his slave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they came to Jesus, they began imploring him earnestly, saying, “He is worthy that you grant this for him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because he loves our nation and he himself built the synagogue for us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus went with them. Now by this time he was not far away from the house, and the centurion sent friends, saying to him, “Lord, do not trouble yourself, for I am not worthy that you should come in under my roof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason neither did I consider myself worthy to come to you. But say the word and my slave must be healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I also am a man placed under authority, who has soldiers under me, and I say to this one, ‘Go!’ and he goes, and to another one, ‘Come!’ and he comes, and to my slave, ‘Do this!’ and he does it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Jesus heard these things, he marveled at him, and turning around to the crowd that was following him, he said, “I tell you, not even in Israel have I found such great faith!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they returned to the house, those who had been sent found the slave healthy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that on the next day he went to a town called Nain, and his disciples and a large crowd went with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he approached the gate of the town, behold, a man who had died was being carried out, his mother’s only son, and she was a widow. And a large crowd from the town was with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Lord saw her, he had compassion for her and said to her, “Do not weep!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came up and touched the bier, and those who were carrying it stopped. And he said, “Young man, I say to you, get up!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the dead man sat up and began to speak, and he gave him to his mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And fear seized them all, and they began to glorify God, saying, “A great prophet has appeared among us!” and “God has visited to help his people!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this report about him went out in the whole of Judea and in all the surrounding region.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his disciples reported to John about all these things. And summoning a certain two of his disciples, John
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: sent them to the Lord, saying, “Are you the one who is to come, or should we look for another?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the men came to him, they said, “John the Baptist sent us to you, saying, ‘Are you the one who is to come, or should we look for another?’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that hour he healed many people of diseases and suffering and evil spirits, and he granted sight to many blind people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answered and said to them, “Go and tell John what you have seen and heard: the blind receive sight, the lame walk, lepers are cleansed, the deaf hear; the dead are raised, the poor have good news announced to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whoever is not offended by me is blessed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the messengers of John had departed, he began to speak to the crowds concerning John: “What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken by the wind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But what did you go out to see? A man dressed in soft clothing? Behold, those who are in splendid clothing and luxury are in the royal palaces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But what did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I tell you, and even more than a prophet!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is this man about whom it is written:
‘Behold, I am sending my messenger before your face,
who will prepare your way before you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, there is no one greater among those born of women than John, but the one who is least in the kingdom of God is greater than he.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (And all the people, when they heard this—even the tax collectors—affirmed the righteousness of God, because they had been baptized with the baptism of John,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but the Pharisees and the legal experts rejected the purpose of God for themselves, because they had not been baptized by him.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “To what then shall I compare the people of this generation, and what are they like?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: For John the Baptist has come not eating bread or drinking wine, and you say, ‘He has a demon!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Son of Man has come eating and drinking, and you say, ‘Behold, a man who is a glutton and a drunkard, a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And wisdom is vindicated by all her children.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now one of the Pharisees asked him to eat with him, and he entered into the house of the Pharisee and reclined at the table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, a woman in the town who was a sinner, when she learned that he was dining in the Pharisee’s house, brought an alabaster flask of perfumed oil,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and standing behind him at his feet weeping, she began to wet his feet with her tears and was wiping them with the hair of her head and was kissing his feet and anointing them with the perfumed oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the Pharisee who invited him saw this, he spoke to himself, saying, “If this man were a prophet, he would have known who and what kind of woman this is who is touching him, that she is a sinner.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered and said to him, “Simon, I have something to say to you.” And he said, “Teacher, say it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “There were two debtors who owed a certain creditor. One owed five hundred denarii and the other fifty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they were not able to repay him, he forgave the debts of both. Now which of them will love him more?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon answered and said, “I suppose that it is the one to whom he forgave more.” And he said to him, “You have judged correctly.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And turning toward the woman, he said to Simon, “Do you see this woman? I entered into your house. You did not give me water for my feet, but she wet my feet with her tears and wiped them with her hair.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You did not give me a kiss, but from the time I entered, she has not stopped kissing my feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You did not anoint my head with olive oil, but she anointed my feet with perfumed oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason I tell you, her sins—which were many—have been forgiven, for she loved much. But the one to whom little is forgiven loves little.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to her, “Your sins are forgiven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those who were reclining at the table with him began to say among themselves, “Who is this who even forgives sins?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to the woman, “Your faith has saved you. Go in peace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that afterward also he was going about from one town and village to another preaching and proclaiming the good news concerning the kingdom of God, and the twelve were with him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and some women who had been healed of evil spirits and diseases: Mary (who was called Magdalene), from whom seven demons had gone out,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Joanna the wife of Chuza (Herod’s household manager), and Susanna, and many others who were helping to support them from their possessions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while a large crowd was gathering and they were going to him from town after town, he spoke by means of a parable:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The sower went out to sow his seed, and while he was sowing, some seed fell on the side of the path and was trampled under foot, and the birds of the sky devoured it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And other seed fell on the rock, and when it came up, it withered, because it did not have moisture.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And other seed fell in the midst of the thorn plants, and the thorn plants grew up with it and choked it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And other seed fell on the good soil, and when it came up, it produced a hundred times as much grain.” As he said these things, he called out, “The one who has ears to hear, let him hear!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his disciples asked him what this parable meant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he said, “To you it has been given to know the mysteries of the kingdom of God, but to the rest they are in parables, so that
‘Seeing they may not see,
and hearing they may not understand.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the parable means this: the seed is the word of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and those beside the path are the ones who have heard. Then the devil comes and takes away the word from their heart, so that they may not believe and be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those on the rock are those who receive the word with joy when they hear it, and these do not have enough root, who believe for a time and in a time of testing fall away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the seed that fell into the thorn plants—these are the ones who hear and as they go along are choked by the worries and riches and pleasures of life, and they do not bear fruit to maturity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the seed on the good soil—these are the ones who, after hearing the word, hold fast to it with a noble and good heart, and bear fruit with patient endurance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And no one, after lighting a lamp, covers it with a jar or puts it under a bed, but puts it on a lampstand, so that those who come in can see the light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For nothing is secret that will not become evident, and nothing hidden that will never be known and come to light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore consider how you listen, for whoever has, to him more will be given, and whoever does not have, even what he thinks that he has will be taken away from him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now his mother and brothers came to him, and they were not able to meet with him because of the crowd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it was reported to him, “Your mother and your brothers are standing outside wanting to see you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered and said to them, “These are my mother and my brothers—the ones who hear the word of God and do it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it happened that on one of the days both he and his disciples got into a boat, and he said to them, “Let us cross over to the other side of the lake.” And they set sail,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and as they were sailing, he fell asleep. And a storm of wind came down on the lake, and they were being swamped and were in danger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they came and woke him up, saying, “Master, master! We are perishing!” So he got up and rebuked the wind and the billowing waves of water and they ceased, and it became calm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Where is your faith?” But they were afraid and were astonished, saying to one another, “Who then is this, that he commands even the winds and the water and they obey him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they sailed to the region of the Gerasenes, which is opposite Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he got out on the land, a certain man from the town met him who had demons and for a considerable time had not worn clothes and did not live in a house, but among the tombs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he saw Jesus, he cried out, fell down before him, and said with a loud voice, “What do I have to do with you, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? I beg you, do not torment me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he had commanded the unclean spirit to come out of the man. (For it had seized him many times, and he was bound with chains and shackles and was guarded, and breaking the bonds he would be driven by the demon into the deserted places.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus asked him, “What is your name?” And he said, “Legion,” because many demons had entered into him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they began imploring him that he would not order them to depart into the abyss.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was a large herd of pigs feeding there on the hill, and they implored him that he would permit them to enter into those pigs. And he permitted them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the demons came out of the man and entered into the pigs, and the herd rushed headlong down the steep slope into the lake and were drowned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the herdsmen saw what had happened, they fled and reported it in the town and in the countryside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they went out to see what had happened, and they came to Jesus and found the man from whom the demons had gone out sitting there clothed and in his right mind, at the feet of Jesus, and they were afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those who had seen it reported to them how the man who had been demon-possessed had been healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the people of the surrounding region of the Gerasenes asked him to depart from them, because they had been seized with great fear. So he got into the boat and returned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the man from who the demons had gone out was begging him to stay with him, but he sent him away, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Return to your home and tell all that God has done for you.” And he went away, proclaiming throughout the whole town all that Jesus had done for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Jesus returned, the crowd welcomed him, because they were all waiting for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, a man who was named Jairus came, and this man was a ruler of the synagogue. And he fell down at the feet of Jesus and began imploring him to come to his house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because he had an only daughter, about twelve years old, and she was dying.
Now as he was going, the crowds were pressing against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a woman who was suffering from hemorrhages for twelve years (who, although she had spent all her assets on physicians, was not able to be healed by anyone)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: came up behind him and touched the edge of his cloak, and immediately her hemorrhaging stopped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said, “Who is the one who touched me?” And when they all denied it, Peter said, “Master, the crowds are pressing you hard and crowding you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said, “Someone touched me, because I know power has gone out from me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the woman saw that she did not escape notice, she came trembling and falling down before him. In the presence of all the people, she told for what reason she had touched him, and that she was healed immediately.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to her, “Daughter, your faith has saved you. Go in peace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was still speaking, someone came from the synagogue ruler’s house, saying, “Your daughter is dead! Trouble the Teacher no longer!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus, when he heard this, replied to him, “Do not be afraid! Only believe, and she will be healed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when he came to the house, he did not allow anyone to enter with him except Peter and John and James and the father and mother of the child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were all weeping and mourning for her, but he said, “Do not weep! For she is not dead, but is sleeping.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they began laughing at him, because they knew that she was dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he took her hand and called, saying, “Child, get up.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And her spirit returned, and she got up immediately, and he ordered something to be given to her to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And her parents were astonished, but he ordered them to tell no one what had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And summoning the twelve, he gave them power and authority over all the demons and to cure diseases,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he sent them out to proclaim the kingdom of God and to heal the sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Take along nothing for the journey—neither a staff, nor a traveler’s bag, nor bread, nor money, nor to have two tunics apiece.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And into whatever house you enter, stay there and depart from there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as for all those who do not welcome you—when you depart from that town, shake off the dust from your feet for a testimony against them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they departed and went throughout the villages, proclaiming the good news and healing everywhere.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Herod the tetrarch heard about all that was happening, and he was greatly perplexed, because it was said by some that John has been raised from the dead,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and by some that Elijah had appeared, and others that some prophet of ancient times had risen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Herod said, “John I beheaded, but who is this about whom I hear such things?” And he was wanting to see him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they returned, the apostles described to him all that they had done. And he took them along and withdrew privately to a town called Bethsaida.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the crowds found out, they followed him, and welcoming them, he began to speak to them about the kingdom of God, and he cured those who had need of healing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the day began to be far spent, and the twelve came up and said to him, “Send away the crowd so that they can go into the surrounding villages and farms to obtain lodging and find provisions, because we are here in a desolate place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said to them, “You give them something to eat!” And they said, “We have no more than five loaves and two fish, unless perhaps we go and purchase food for all these people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For there were about five thousand men.) So he said to his disciples, “Have them sit down in groups of about fifty each.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they did so, and had them all sit down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And taking the five loaves and the two fish, and looking up to heaven, he gave thanks and broke them and began giving them to the disciples to set before the crowd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they all ate and were satisfied, and what was left over was picked up by them—twelve baskets of broken pieces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that while he was praying alone, the disciples were with him. And he asked them, saying, “Who do the crowds say that I am?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they answered and said, “John the Baptist, but others, Elijah, and others, that one of the ancient prophets has risen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “But who do you say that I am?” And Peter answered and said, “The Christ of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he warned and commanded them to tell this to no one,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “It is necessary for the Son of Man to suffer many things and to be rejected by the elders and chief priests and scribes, and to be killed, and to be raised on the third day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them all, “If anyone wants to come after me, he must deny himself and take up his cross every day and follow me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoever wants to save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life on account of me, this person will save it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what is a person benefited if he gains the whole world but loses or forfeits himself?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoever is ashamed of me and my words, the Son of Man will be ashamed of this person when he comes in his glory and the glory of the Father and of the holy angels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I tell you truly, there are some of those standing here who will never experience death until they see the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it happened that about eight days after these words, he took along Peter and John and James and went up on the mountain to pray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he was praying, the appearance of his face became different, and his clothing became white, gleaming like lightning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, two men were talking with him, who were Moses and Elijah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who appeared in glory and were speaking about his departure which he was about to fulfill in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Peter and those with him were very sleepy, but when they became fully awake, they saw his glory and the two men who were standing with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that as they were going away from him, Peter said to Jesus, “Master, it is good for us to be here. And let us make three shelters, one for you and one for Moses and one for Elijah,” not knowing what he was saying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while he was saying these things, a cloud came and overshadowed them, and they were afraid as they entered into the cloud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a voice came from the cloud, saying, “This is my Son, my Chosen One. Listen to him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after the voice had occurred, Jesus was found alone. And they kept silent and told no one in those days anything of what they had seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it happened that on the next day, when they had come down from the mountain, a large crowd met him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, a man from the crowd cried out, saying, “Teacher, I beg you to look with concern on my son, because he is my only son!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, a spirit seizes him and suddenly he screams, and it convulses him with foam and rarely withdraws from him, battering him severely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I begged your disciples that they would expel it, and they were not able to do so.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus answered and said, “O unbelieving and perverted generation! How long will I be with you and put up with you? Bring your son here!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while he was still approaching, the demon threw him down and convulsed him. But Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit and healed the boy, and gave him back to his father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And they were all astounded at the impressiveness of God.
But while they were all marveling at all the things that he was doing, he said to his disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You take these words to heart, for the Son of Man is about to be betrayed into the hands of men.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they did not understand this statement, and it was concealed from them so that they could not understand it. And they were afraid to ask him about this statement.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And an argument developed among them as to who of them might be greatest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus, because he knew the thoughts of their hearts, took hold of a child and had him stand beside him
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to them, “Whoever welcomes this child in my name welcomes me, and whoever welcomes me welcomes the one who sent me. For the one who is least among you all—this one is great.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And John answered and said, “Master, we saw someone expelling demons in your name, and we tried to prevent him, because he does not follow in company with us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said to him, “Do not prevent him, because whoever is not against you is for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it happened that when the days were approaching for him to be taken up, he set his face to go to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he sent messengers before him, and they went and entered into a village of the Samaritans in order to prepare for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they did not welcome him because he was determined to go to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the disciples James and John saw it, they said, “Lord, do you want us to call fire to come down from heaven and consume them?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he turned around and rebuked them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they proceeded to another village.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they were traveling on the road, someone said to him, “I will follow you wherever you go!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to him, “Foxes have dens and birds of the sky have nests, but the Son of Man has no place to lay his head.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to another, “Follow me!” But he said, “Lord, first allow me to go and bury my father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said to him, “Leave the dead to bury their own dead! But you go and proclaim the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And another person also said, “I will follow you, Lord, but first allow me to say farewell to those in my house.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said, “No one who puts his hand on the plow and looks back is fit for the kingdom of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after these things, the Lord also appointed seventy-two others and sent them out two by two before him into every town and place where he was about to go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “The harvest is plentiful, but the workers are few. Therefore ask the Lord of the harvest that he send out workers into his harvest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go! Behold, I am sending you out like lambs in the midst of wolves!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not carry a money bag or a traveler’s bag or sandals, and greet no one along the road.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And into whatever house you enter, first say, “Peace be to this household!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if a son of peace is there, your peace will rest on him. But if not, it will return to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And remain in the same house, eating and drinking whatever they provide, for the worker is worthy of his pay. Do not move from house to house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And into whatever town you enter and they welcome you, eat whatever is set before you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and heal the sick in it, and say to them, “The kingdom of God has come near to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But into whatever town you enter and they do not welcome you, go out into its streets and say,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Even the dust of your town that clings to our feet we wipe off against you! Nevertheless know this: that the kingdom of God has come near!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you that it will be more bearable on that day for Sodom than for that town!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the miracles that were done in you had been done in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented long ago, sitting in sackcloth and ashes!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it will be more bearable for Tyre and for Sidon in the judgment than for you!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you, Capernaum, will you be exalted to heaven? No! You will be brought down to Hades!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who listens to you listens to me, and the one who rejects you rejects me. But the one who rejects me rejects the one who sent me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the seventy-two returned with joy, saying, “Lord, even the demons are subject to us in your name!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said to them, “I saw Satan falling like lightning from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I have given you the authority to tread on snakes and scorpions, and over all the power of the enemy, and nothing will ever harm you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, do not rejoice in this, that the spirits are subject to you, but rejoice that your names are inscribed in heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that same time he rejoiced in the Holy Spirit and said, “I praise you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that you have hidden these things from the wise and intelligent and have revealed them to young children. Yes, Father, for this was pleasing before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All things have been handed over to me by my Father, and no one knows who the Son is except the Father and who the Father is except the Son, and anyone to whom the Son wants to reveal him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And turning to the disciples, he said privately, “Blessed are the eyes that see the things which you see!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I tell you that many prophets and kings desired to see the things which you see, and did not see them, and to hear the things which you hear, and did not hear them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, a certain legal expert stood up to test him, saying, “Teacher, what must I do so that I will inherit eternal life?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to him, “What is written in the law? How do you read it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answered and said, “You shall love the Lord your God from all your heart, and with all your soul, and with all your strength, and with all your mind, and your neighbor as yourself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to him, “You have answered correctly. Do this and you will live.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he, wanting to justify himself, said to Jesus, “And who is my neighbor?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus replied and said, “A certain man was going down from Jerusalem to Jericho, and fell into the hands of robbers, who both stripped him and beat him. After inflicting blows on him, they went away, leaving him half dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator
