verses.text: Now by coincidence a certain priest was going down on that road, and when he saw him, he passed by on the opposite side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the same way also a Levite, when he came down to the place and saw him, passed by on the opposite side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But a certain Samaritan who was traveling came up to him and, when he saw him, had compassion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came up and bandaged his wounds, pouring on olive oil and wine, and he put him on his own animal and brought him to an inn and took care of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the next day, he took out two denarii and gave them to the innkeeper, and said, “Take care of him, and whatever you spend in addition, I will repay to you when I return.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which of these three do you suppose became a neighbor of the man who fell among the robbers?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said, “The one who showed mercy to him.” And Jesus said to him, “You go and do likewise.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as they traveled along, he entered into a certain village. And a certain woman named Martha welcomed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she had a sister named Mary, who also sat at the feet of Jesus and was listening to his teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Martha was distracted with much preparation, so she approached and said, “Lord, is it not a concern to you that my sister has left me alone to make preparations? Then tell her that she should help me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord answered and said to her, “Martha, Martha, you are anxious and troubled about many things!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But few things are necessary, or only one thing, for Mary has chosen the better part, which will not be taken away from her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that while he was in a certain place praying, when he stopped a certain one of his disciples said to him, “Lord, teach us to pray, just as John also taught his disciples.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he said to them, “When you pray, say,
“Father,
may your name be treated as holy.
May your kingdom come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give us each day our daily bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And forgive us our sins,
    for we ourselves also forgive everyone who is indebted to us.
And do not lead us into temptation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Who of you will have a friend, and will go to him at midnight and say to him, ‘Friend, lend me three loaves,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because a friend of mine has come to me on a journey, and I do not have anything to set before him.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And that one will answer from inside and say, ‘Do not cause me trouble! The door has already been shut and my children are with me in bed! I am not able to get up to give you anything.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, even if he does not give him anything after he gets up because he is his friend, at any rate because of his impudence he will get up and give him whatever he needs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I tell you, ask and it will be given to you; seek and you will find; knock and it will be opened for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For everyone who asks receives, and the one who seeks finds, and to the one who knocks it will be opened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But what father from among you, if his son will ask for a fish, instead of a fish will give him a snake?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or also, if he will ask for an egg, will give him a scorpion?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore if you, although you are evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will the Father from heaven give the Holy Spirit to those who ask him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was expelling a mute demon. Now it happened that when the demon came out, the man who had been mute spoke, and the crowds were astonished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some of them said, “By Beelzebul the ruler of demons he expels demons!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And others, in order to test him, were demanding from him a sign from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he, knowing their thoughts, said to them, “Every kingdom divided against itself is laid waste, and a divided household falls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So if Satan also is divided against himself, how will his kingdom stand? For you say that I expel demons by Beelzebul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if I expel demons by Beelzebul, by whom do your sons expel them? For this reason they will be your judges!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if I expel demons by the finger of God, then the kingdom of God has come upon you!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When a strong man, fully armed, guards his own palace, his possessions are safe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when a stronger man attacks him and conquers him, he takes away his full armor in which he trusted and distributes his plunder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who is not with me is against me, and the one who does not gather with me scatters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whenever an unclean spirit has gone out of a person, it travels through waterless places searching for rest, and does not find it. It says, ‘I will return to my house from which I came out.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when it arrives it finds the house swept and put in order.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then it goes and brings along seven other spirits more evil than itself, and they go in and live there. And the last state of that person becomes worse than the first!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it happened that as he said these things, a certain woman from the crowd raised her voice and said to him, “Blessed is the womb that bore you, and the breasts at which you nursed!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said, “On the contrary, blessed are those who hear the word of God and follow it!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as the crowds were increasing, he began to say, “This generation is an evil generation! It demands a sign, and no sign will be given to it except the sign of Jonah!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For just as Jonah became a sign to the Ninevites, so also the Son of Man will be to this generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The queen of the south will rise up at the judgment with the people of this generation and condemn them, because she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon, and behold, something greater than Solomon is here!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people of Nineveh will stand up at the judgment with this generation and condemn it, because they repented at the proclamation of Jonah, and behold, something greater than Jonah is here!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “No one after lighting a lamp puts it in a cellar or under a bushel basket, but on a lampstand, so that those who come in can see the light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your eye is the lamp of the body. When your eye is sincere, your whole body is full of light also. But when it is evil, your body is dark also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore pay careful attention that the light in you is not darkness!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If therefore your whole body is full of light, not having any part dark, it will be completely full of light, as when the lamp with its light gives light to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he was speaking, a Pharisee asked him to have a meal with him, and he went in and reclined at table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Pharisee, when he saw it, was astonished that he did not first wash before the meal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord said to him, “Now you Pharisees cleanse the outside of the cup and of the dish, but your inside is full of greediness and wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fools! Did not the one who made the outside make the inside also?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But give as charitable giving the things that are within, and behold, everything is clean for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But woe to you, Pharisees, because you pay a tenth of mint and rue and every garden herb, and neglect justice and love for God! But it was necessary to do these things without neglecting those things also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe to you, Pharisees, because you love the best seat in the synagogues and the greetings in the marketplaces!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe to you, because you are like unmarked graves, and the people who walk over them do not know it!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one of the legal experts answered and said to him, “Teacher, when you say these things, you insult us also!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said, “Woe to you also, legal experts, because you load people with burdens hard to bear, and you yourselves do not touch the burdens with one of your fingers!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe to you, because you build the tombs of the prophets, and your fathers killed them!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As a result you are witnesses, and you approve of the deeds of your fathers, because they killed them and you build their tombs!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason also the wisdom of God said, ‘I will send to them prophets and apostles, and some of them they will kill and persecute,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that the blood of all the prophets that has been shed from the foundation of the world may be required of this generation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the blood of Abel to the blood of Zechariah, who perished between the altar and the temple building. Yes, I tell you, it will be required of this generation!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe to you, legal experts, because you have taken away the key to knowledge! You did not enter yourselves, and you hindered those who were entering!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he departed from there, the scribes and the Pharisees began to be terribly hostile, and to question him closely about many things,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: plotting to catch him with reference to something he might say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: During this time when a crowd of many thousands had gathered together, so that they were trampling one another, he began to say to his disciples first, “Beware for yourselves of the leaven of the Pharisees, which is hypocrisy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But nothing is concealed that will not be revealed, and secret that will not be made known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore everything that you have said in the dark will be heard in the light, and what you have whispered in the inner rooms will be proclaimed on the housetops.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And I tell you, my friends, do not be afraid of those who kill the body, and after these things do not have anything more to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I will show you whom you should fear: fear the one who has authority, after the killing, to throw you into hell! Yes, I tell you, fear this one!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are not five sparrows sold for two pennies? And not one of them is forgotten in the sight of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But even the hairs of your head are all numbered! Do not be afraid; you are worth more than many sparrows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And I tell you, everyone who acknowledges me before people, the Son of Man also will acknowledge him before the angels of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but the one who denies me before people will be denied before the angels of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And everyone who speaks a word against the Son of Man, it will be forgiven him, but to the one who blasphemes against the Holy Spirit, it will not be forgiven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when they bring you before the synagogues and the rulers and the authorities, do not be anxious how or what you should speak in your own defense or what you should say,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the Holy Spirit will teach you in that same hour what it is necessary to say.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now someone from the crowd said to him, “Teacher, tell my brother to divide the inheritance with me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said to him, “Man, who made me a judge or an arbitrator over you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Watch out and guard yourselves from all greediness, because not even when someone has an abundance does his life consist of his possessions.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he told a parable to them, saying, “The land of a certain rich man yielded an abundant harvest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he reasoned to himself, saying, ‘What should I do? For I do not have anywhere I can gather in my crops.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, ‘I will do this: I will tear down my barns and build larger ones, and I will gather in there all my grain and possessions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will say to my soul, “Soul, you have many possessions stored up for many years. Relax, eat, drink, celebrate!”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God said to him, ‘Fool! This night your life is demanded from you, and the things which you have prepared—whose will they be?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So is the one who stores up treasure for himself, and who is not rich toward God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to his disciples, “For this reason I tell you, do not be anxious for your life, what you will eat, or for your body, what you will wear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For life is more than food, and the body more than clothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Consider the ravens, that they neither sow nor reap; to them there is neither storeroom nor barn, and God feeds them. How much more are you worth than the birds?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And which of you by being anxious is able to add an hour to his life span?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If then you are not even able to do a very little thing, why are you anxious about the rest?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Consider the lilies, how they grow: they do not toil or spin, but I say to you, not even Solomon in all his glory was dressed like one of these.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if God clothes the grass in the field in this way, although it is here today and tomorrow is thrown into the oven, how much more will he do so for you, you of little faith?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you, do not consider what you will eat and what you will drink, and do not be anxious.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all the nations of the world seek after these things, and your Father knows that you need these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But seek his kingdom and these things will be added to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Do not be afraid, little flock, because your Father is well pleased to give you the kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sell your possessions and give charitable gifts. Make for yourselves money bags that do not wear out, an inexhaustible treasure in heaven where thief does not approach or moth destroy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You must be prepared for action and your lamps burning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you, be like people who are waiting for their master when he returns from the wedding feast, so that when he comes back and knocks, they can open the door for him immediately.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed are those slaves whom the master will find on the alert when he returns! Truly I say to you that he will dress himself for service and have them recline at the table and will come by and serve them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even if he should come back in the second or in the third watch of the night and find them like this, blessed are they!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But understand this, that if the master of the house had known what hour the thief was coming, he would not have left his house to be broken into.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You also must be ready, because the Son of Man is coming at an hour that you do not think he will come.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter said, “Lord, are you telling this parable for us, or also for everyone?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said, “Who then is the faithful wise manager whom the master will put in charge over his servants to give them their food allowance at the right time?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed is that slave whom his master will find so doing when he comes back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly I say to you that he will put him in charge of all his possessions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if that slave should say to himself, ‘My master is taking a long time to return,’ and he begins to beat the male slaves and the female slaves and to eat and drink and get drunk,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the master of that slave will come on a day that he does not expect and at an hour that he does not know, and will cut him in two and assign his place with the unbelievers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And that slave who knew the will of his master and did not prepare or do according to his will will be given a severe beating.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the one who did not know and did things deserving blows will be given a light beating. And from everyone to whom much has been given, much will be demanded, and from him to whom they entrusted much, they will ask him for even more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have come to bring fire on the earth, and how I wish that it had been kindled already!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I have a baptism to be baptized with, and how I am distressed until it is accomplished!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you think that I have come to grant peace on the earth? No, I tell you, but rather division!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For from now on there will be five in one household, divided three against two and two against three.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will be divided, father against son and son against father, mother against daughter and daughter against mother, mother-in-law against her daughter-in-law and daughter-in-law against mother-in-law.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he also said to the crowds, “When you see a cloud coming up in the west, you say at once, ‘A rainstorm is coming,’ and so it happens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when you see the south wind blowing, you say, ‘There will be burning heat,’ and it happens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hypocrites! You know how to evaluate the appearance of the earth and the sky, but how is it you do not know how to evaluate this present time?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And why do you not also judge for yourselves what is right?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as you are going with your accuser before the magistrate, make an effort to come to a settlement with him on the way, so that he will not drag you to the judge, and the judge will hand you over to the bailiff, and the bailiff will throw you into prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, you will never get out of there until you have paid back even the last cent!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now at the same time some had come to tell him about the Galileans whose blood Pilate had mixed with their sacrifices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answered and said to them, “Do you think that these Galileans were sinners worse than all the Galileans, because they suffered these things?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No, I tell you, but unless you repent you will all perish as well!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or those eighteen on whom the tower in Siloam fell and killed them—do you think that they were sinners worse than all the people who live in Jerusalem?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No, I tell you, but unless you repent, you will all perish as well!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he told this parable: “A certain man had a fig tree planted in his vineyard, and he came looking for fruit on it and did not find any.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said to the gardener, ‘Behold, for three years I have come looking for fruit on this fig tree and did not find any. Cut it down! Why should it even exhaust the soil?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered and said to him, ‘Sir, leave it alone this year also, until I dig around it and put manure on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if indeed it produces fruit in the coming year, so much the better, but if not, you can cut it down.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he was teaching in one of the synagogues on the Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, a woman was there who had a spirit that had disabled her for eighteen years, and she was bent over and not able to straighten herself up completely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he saw her, Jesus summoned her and said to her, “Woman, you are freed from your disability!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he placed his hands on her, and immediately she straightened up and glorified God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the ruler of the synagogue, indignant because Jesus had healed on the Sabbath, answered and said to the crowd, “There are six days on which it is necessary to work. Therefore come and be healed on them, and not on the day of the Sabbath!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord answered and said to him, “Hypocrites! Does not each one of you untie his ox or his donkey from the feeding trough on the Sabbath and lead it away to water it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this woman, who is a daughter of Abraham, whom Satan bound eighteen long years—is it not necessary that she be released from this bond on the day of the Sabbath?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he said these things, all those who opposed him were humiliated, and the whole crowd was rejoicing at all the splendid things that were being done by him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore he said, “What is the kingdom of God like, and to what shall I compare it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is like a mustard seed that a man took and sowed in his own garden, and it grew and became a tree, and the birds of the sky nested in its branches.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And again he said, “To what shall I compare the kingdom of God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is like yeast that a woman took and hid in three measures of wheat flour until the whole batch was leavened.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was going throughout towns and villages, teaching and making his journey toward Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And someone said to him, “Lord, are there only a few who are saved?” And he said to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Make every effort to enter through the narrow door, because many, I tell you, will seek to enter and will not be able to,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when once the master of the house has gotten up and shut the door, and you begin to stand outside and knock on the door, saying, ‘Lord, open the door for us!’ And he will answer and say to you, ‘I do not know where you are from!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you will begin to say, ‘We ate and drank in your presence, and you taught in our streets!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he will reply, saying to you, ‘I do not know where you are from! Go away from me, all you evildoers!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that place there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth, when you see Abraham and Isaac and Jacob and all the prophets in the kingdom of God, but yourselves thrown outside!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they will come from east and west, and from north and south, and will recline at the table in the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, some are last who will be first, and some are first who will be last.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that same hour some Pharisees came up and said to him, “Go out and depart from here, because Herod wants to kill you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Go and tell that fox, ‘Behold, I am expelling demons and performing healings today and tomorrow, and on the third day I will complete my work.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, it is necessary for me to be on the way today and tomorrow and on the next day, because it is not possible for a prophet to perish outside Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Jerusalem, Jerusalem, the one who kills the prophets and stones those who are sent to her! How many times I wanted to gather your children together the way a hen gathers her own brood under her wings, and you were not willing!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, your house has been left to you! And I tell you, you will never see me until the time will come when you say, ‘Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the Lord!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that when he came to the house of a certain one of the leaders of the Pharisees on a Sabbath to eat a meal, they were watching him closely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, a certain man was in front of him, suffering from edema.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered and said to the legal experts and Pharisees, saying, “Is it permitted to heal on the Sabbath, or not?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they remained silent. And he took hold of him and healed him, and sent him away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Who among you, if your son or your ox falls into a well on the day of the Sabbath, will not immediately pull him out?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were not able to make a reply to these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he told a parable to those who had been invited when he noticed how they were choosing for themselves the places of honor, saying to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you are invited by someone to a wedding feast, do not recline at the table in the place of honor, lest someone more distinguished than you has been invited by him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the one who invited you both will come and say to you, ‘Give the place to this person,’ and then with shame you will begin to take the last place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when you are invited, go and recline at the table in the last place, so that when the one who invited you comes, he will say to you, ‘Friend, move up higher.’ Then it will be an honor to you in the presence of all those who are reclining at the table with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, and the one who humbles himself will be exalted.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he also said to the one who had invited him, “When you give a dinner or a banquet, do not invite your friends or your brothers or your relatives or wealthy neighbors, lest they also invite you in return, and repayment come to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But whenever you give a banquet, invite the poor, the crippled, the lame, the blind,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you will be blessed, because they are not able to repay you. For it will be paid back to you at the resurrection of the righteous.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when one of those reclining at the table with him heard these things, he said to him, “Blessed is everyone who will eat bread in the kingdom of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said to him, “A certain man was giving a large banquet and invited many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he sent his slave at the hour of the banquet to say to those who have been invited, ‘Come, because now it is ready!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they all alike began to excuse themselves. The first said to him, ‘I have purchased a field, and I must go out to look at it. I ask you, consider me excused.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And another said, ‘I have purchased five yoke of oxen, and I am going to examine them. I ask you, consider me excused.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And another said, ‘I have married a wife, and for this reason I am not able to come.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the slave came and reported these things to his master. Then the master of the house became angry and said to his slave, ‘Go out quickly into the streets and alleys of the city and bring in here the poor and crippled and blind and lame!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the slave said, ‘Sir, what you ordered has been done, and there is still room.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the master said to the slave, ‘Go out into the highways and hedges and press them to come in, so that my house will be filled!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I say to you that none of those persons who were invited will taste my banquet!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now large crowds were going along with him, and he turned around and said to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If anyone comes to me and does not hate his own father and mother and wife and children and brothers and sisters, and furthermore, even his own life, he cannot be my disciple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever does not carry his own cross and follow me cannot be my disciple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For which of you, wanting to build a tower, does not first sit down and calculate the cost to see if he has enough to complete it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Otherwise after he has laid the foundation and is not able to finish it, all who see it will begin to ridicule him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, ‘This man began to build and was not able to finish!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or what king, going out to engage another king in battle, does not sit down first and deliberate whether he is able with ten thousand to oppose the one coming against him with twenty thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if not, while the other is still far away, he sends an ambassador and asks for terms of peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way, therefore, every one of you who does not renounce all his own possessions cannot be my disciple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now salt is good, but if salt becomes tasteless, with what will it be made salty?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is usable neither for the soil nor for the manure pile; they throw it out. The one who has ears to hear, let him hear!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now all the tax collectors and the sinners were drawing near to hear him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And both the Pharisees and the scribes were complaining, saying, “This man welcomes sinners and eats with them!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he told them this parable, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What man of you, having a hundred sheep and losing one of them, does not leave the ninety-nine in the grassland and go after the one that was lost until he finds it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he has found it, he places it on his shoulders, rejoicing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he returns to his home, he calls together his friends and neighbors, saying to them, ‘Rejoice with me, because I have found my sheep that was lost!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you that in the same way, there will be more joy in heaven over one sinner who repents than over ninety-nine righteous people who have no need of repentance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or what woman who has ten drachmas, if she loses one drachma, does not light a lamp and sweep the house and search carefully until she finds it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when she has found it, she calls together her friends and neighbors, saying, ‘Rejoice with me, because I have found the drachma that I had lost!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way, I tell you, there is joy in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner who repents.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “A certain man had two sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the younger of them said to his father, ‘Father, give me the share of the property that is coming to me.’ So he divided his assets between them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after not many days, the younger son gathered everything and went on a journey to a distant country, and there he squandered his wealth by living wastefully.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after he had spent everything, there was a severe famine throughout that country, and he began to be in need.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went and hired himself out to one of the citizens of that country, and he sent him into his fields to tend pigs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was longing to fill his stomach with the carob pods that the pigs were eating, and no one was giving anything to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But when he came to himself, he said, ‘How many of my father’s hired workers have an abundance of food, and I am dying here from hunger!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will set out and go to my father and will say to him, ‘Father, I have sinned against heaven and in your sight!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am no longer worthy to be called your son! Make me like one of your hired workers.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he set out and came to his own father. But while he was still a long way away, his father saw him and had compassion, and ran and embraced him and kissed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his son said to him, ‘Father, I have sinned against heaven and in your sight! I am no longer worthy to be called your son!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But his father said to his slaves, ‘Quickly bring out the best robe and put it on him, and put a ring on his finger and sandals on his feet!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And bring the fattened calf—kill it and let us eat and celebrate,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because this son of mine was dead, and is alive again! He was lost and is found!’ And they began to celebrate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now his older son was in the field, and when he came and approached the house, he heard music and dancing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he summoned one of the slaves and asked what these things meant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to him, ‘Your brother has come, and your father has killed the fattened calf because he has gotten him back healthy.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he became angry and did not want to go in. So his father came out and began to implore him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered and said to his father, ‘Behold, so many years I have served you, and have never disobeyed your command! And you never gave me a young goat so that I could celebrate with my friends!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when this son of yours returned—who has consumed your assets with prostitutes—you killed the fattened calf for him!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said to him, ‘Child, you are always with me, and everything I have belongs to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it was necessary to celebrate and to rejoice, because this brother of yours was dead, and is alive, and was lost, and is found!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he also said to the disciples, “A certain man was rich, who had a manager. And charges were brought to him that this person was squandering his possessions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he summoned him and said to him, ‘What is this I hear about you? Give the account of your management, because you can no longer manage.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the manager said to himself, ‘What should I do, because my master is taking away the management from me? I am not strong enough to dig; I am ashamed to beg.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know what I should do, so that when I am removed from the management they will welcome me into their homes!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he summoned each one of his own master’s debtors and said to the first, ‘How much do you owe my master?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, ‘A hundred measures of olive oil.’ So he said to him, ‘Take your promissory note and sit down quickly and write fifty.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to another, ‘And how much do you owe?’ And he said, ‘A hundred measures of wheat.’ He said to him, ‘Take your promissory note and write eighty.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the master praised the dishonest manager, because he had acted shrewdly. For the sons of this age are shrewder than the sons of light with regard to their own generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I tell you, make friends for yourselves by means of unrighteous wealth, so that when it runs out they will welcome you into the eternal dwellings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The one who is faithful in very little is also faithful in much, and the one who is dishonest in very little is also dishonest in much.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If then you have not been faithful with unrighteous wealth, who will entrust to you the true riches?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if you have not been faithful with what belongs to another, who will give you your own?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No domestic slave is able to serve two masters, for either he will hate the one and love the other, or he will be devoted to one and will despise the other. You are not able to serve God and money.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Pharisees, who were lovers of money, heard all these things, and they ridiculed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “You are the ones who justify themselves in the sight of men, but God knows your hearts! For what is considered exalted among men is an abomination in the sight of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The law and the prophets were until John; from that time on the kingdom of God has been proclaimed, and everyone is urgently pressed into it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it is easier for heaven and earth to pass away than for one stroke of a letter of the law to become invalid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Everyone who divorces his wife and marries another commits adultery, and the one who marries a woman divorced from her husband commits adultery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now a certain man was rich, and dressed in purple cloth and fine linen, feasting sumptuously every day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a certain poor man named Lazarus, covered with sores, lay at his gate,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and was longing to be filled with what fell from the table of the rich man. But even the dogs came and licked his sores.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it happened that the poor man died, and he was carried away by the angels to Abraham’s side. And the rich man also died and was buried.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in Hades he lifted up his eyes as he was in torment and saw Abraham from a distance, and Lazarus at his side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he called out and said, ‘Father Abraham, have mercy on me, and send Lazarus so that he could dip the tip of his finger in water and cool my tongue, because I am suffering pain in this flame!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Abraham said, ‘Child, remember that you received your good things during your life, and Lazarus likewise bad things. But now he is comforted here, but you are suffering pain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in addition to all these things, a great chasm has been established between us and you, so that those who want to cross over from here to you are not able to do so, nor can they cross over from there to us.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said, ‘Then I ask you, father, that you send him to my father’s house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I have five brothers, so that he could warn them, in order that they also should not come to this place of torment!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Abraham said, ‘They have Moses and the prophets; they must listen to them.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, ‘No, father Abraham, but if someone from the dead goes to them, they will repent!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said to him, ‘If they do not listen to Moses and the prophets, neither will they be convinced if someone rises from the dead.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to his disciples, “It is impossible for causes for stumbling not to come, but woe to him through whom they come!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It would be better for him if a millstone is placed around his neck and he is thrown into the sea than that he causes one of these little ones to sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Be concerned about yourselves! If your brother sins, rebuke him, and if he repents, forgive him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if he sins against you seven times in a day, and seven times he returns to you saying, ‘I repent,’ you must forgive him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the apostles said to the Lord, “Increase our faith!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord said, “If you have faith like a mustard seed, you could say to this mulberry tree, ‘Be uprooted and planted in the sea,’ and it would obey you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And which of you who has a slave plowing or shepherding sheep who comes in from the field will say to him, ‘Come here at once and recline at the table’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will he not rather say to him, ‘Prepare something that I may eat, and dress yourself to serve me while I eat and drink, and after these things you will eat and drink.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will not be grateful to the slave because he did what was ordered, will he?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus you also, when you have done all the things you were ordered to do, say, ‘We are unworthy slaves; we have done what we were obligated to do.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that while traveling toward Jerusalem, he was passing through the region between Samaria and Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he was entering into a certain village, ten men met him—lepers, who stood at a distance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they raised their voices, saying, “Jesus, Master, have mercy on us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he saw them he said to them, “Go and show yourselves to the priests.” And it happened that as they were going, they were cleansed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But one of them, when he saw that he was healed, turned back, praising God with a loud voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he fell on his face at his feet, giving thanks to him. And he was a Samaritan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus answered and said, “Were not ten cleansed? And where are the nine?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Was no one found to turn back and give praise to God except this foreigner?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to him, “Get up and go your way. Your faith has saved you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when he was asked by the Pharisees when the kingdom of God would come, he answered them and said, “The kingdom of God does not come with things that can be observed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor will they say, ‘Behold, here it is!’ or ‘There!’ For behold, the kingdom of God is in your midst.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to the disciples, “Days will come when you will desire to see one of the days of the Son of Man, and you will not see it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they will say to you, ‘Behold, there!’ ‘Behold, here!’ Do not go out or run after them!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For just as the lightning shines forth, flashing from one place under heaven to another place under heaven, so the Son of Man will be in his day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But first it is necessary for him to suffer many things, and to be rejected by this generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And just as it was in the days of Noah, so also it will be in the days of the Son of Man—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they were eating, they were drinking, they were marrying, they were being given in marriage, until the day Noah entered into the ark, and the flood came and destroyed them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise, just as it was in the days of Lot—they were eating, they were drinking, they were buying, they were selling, they were planting, they were building.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But on the day that Lot went out from Sodom, it rained fire and sulphur from heaven and destroyed them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will be just the same on the day that the Son of Man is revealed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day, whoever is on the housetop and his goods are in the house must not come down to take them away. And likewise the one who is in the field must not turn back
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember Lot’s wife!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever seeks to preserve his life will lose it, but whoever loses it will keep it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you that in that night there will be two in one bed; one will be taken and the other will be left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There will be two women grinding at the same place; one will be taken and the other will be left.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they answered and said to him, “Where, Lord?” So he said to them, “Where the dead body is, there also the vultures will be gathered.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he told them a parable to show that they must always pray and not be discouraged,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “There was a certain judge in a certain town who did not fear God and did not respect people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was a widow in that town, and she kept coming to him, saying, ‘Grant me justice against my adversary!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was not willing for a time, but after these things he said to himself, ‘Even if I do not fear God or respect people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yet because this widow is causing trouble for me, I will grant her justice, so that she does not wear me down in the end by her coming back!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said, “Listen to what the unrighteous judge is saying!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And will not God surely see to it that justice is done to his chosen ones who cry out to him day and night, and will he delay toward them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you that he will see to it that justice is done for them soon! Nevertheless, when the Son of Man comes, then will he find faith on earth?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he also told this parable to some who trusted in themselves that they were righteous, and looked down on everyone else:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Two men went up to the temple to pray, one a Pharisee and the other a tax collector.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisee stood and prayed these things with reference to himself: ‘God, I give thanks to you that I am not like other people—swindlers, unrighteous people, adulterers, or even like this tax collector!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I fast twice a week; I give a tenth of all that I get.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the tax collector, standing far away, did not want even to raise his eyes to heaven, but was beating his breast, saying, ‘God, be merciful to me, a sinner!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, this man went down to his house justified rather than that one! For everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, but the one who humbles himself will be exalted.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now they were bringing even their babies to him so that he could touch them. But when the disciples saw it, they rebuked them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus called them to himself, saying, “Allow the children to come to me, and do not forbid them, for to such belongs the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly I say to you, whoever does not welcome the kingdom of God like a young child will never enter into it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a certain ruler asked him, saying, “Good Teacher, by doing what will I inherit eternal life?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to him, “Why do you call me good? No one is good except God alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know the commandments: ‘Do not commit adultery, do not murder, do not steal, do not give false testimony, honor your father and mother.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “All these I have observed from my youth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he heard this, Jesus said to him, “You still lack one thing: Sell all that you have, and distribute the proceeds to the poor—and you will have treasure in heaven—and come, follow me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when he heard these things he became very sad, because he was extremely wealthy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus took notice of him and said, “How difficult it is for those who possess wealth to enter into the kingdom of God!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich person to enter into the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So those who heard this said, “And who can be saved?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said, “What is impossible with men is possible with God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter said, “Behold, we have left all that is ours and followed you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Truly I say to you that there is no one who has left house or wife or brothers or parents or children on account of the kingdom of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who will not receive many times more in this time and in the age to come, eternal life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And taking aside the twelve, he said to them, “Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem, and all the things that are written by the prophets with reference to the Son of Man will be accomplished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he will be handed over to the Gentiles and will be mocked and mistreated and spit on,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and after flogging him they will kill him, and on the third day he will rise.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they understood none of these things, and this saying was concealed from them, and they did not comprehend the things that were said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it happened that as he drew near to Jericho, a certain blind man was sitting on the side of the road begging.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he heard a crowd going by, he inquired what this meant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they told him, “Jesus the Nazarene is passing by.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he called out, saying, “Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those who were in front rebuked him, that he should be silent, but he cried out even more loudly, “Son of David, have mercy on me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus stopped and ordered him to be brought to him. And when he approached, he asked him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What do you want me to do for you?” And he said, “Lord, that I may regain my sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to him, “Regain your sight! Your faith has saved you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately he regained his sight and began to follow him, glorifying God. And all the people, when they saw it, gave praise to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he entered and traveled through Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was a man named Zacchaeus, and he was a chief tax collector, and he was rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was seeking to see Jesus—who he was—and he was not able to as a result of the crowd, because he was short in stature.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he ran on ahead and climbed up into a sycamore tree so that he could see him, because he was going to go through that way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he came to the place, Jesus looked up and said to him, “Zacchaeus, come down quickly, because it is necessary for me to stay at your house today!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came down quickly and welcomed him joyfully.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they saw it, they all began to complain, saying, “He has gone in to find lodging with a man who is a sinner!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Zacchaeus stopped and said to the Lord, “Behold, half of my possessions, Lord, I am giving to the poor, and if I have extorted anything from anyone, I am paying it back four times as much!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to him, “Today salvation has come to this house, because he too is a son of Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Son of Man came to seek and to save those who are lost.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now while they were listening to these things, he went on and told a parable, because he was near Jerusalem and they thought that the kingdom of God was going to appear immediately.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore he said, “A certain nobleman traveled to a distant country to receive for himself a kingdom and to return.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And summoning ten of his own slaves, he gave them ten minas and said to them, ‘Do business until I come back.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But his citizens hated him, and sent a delegation after him, saying, ‘We do not want this man to be king over us!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that when he returned after receiving the kingdom, he ordered these slaves to whom he had given the money to be summoned to him, so that he could know what they had gained by trading.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the first arrived, saying, ‘Sir, your mina has made ten minas more!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to him, ‘Well done, good slave! Because you have been faithful in a very small thing, have authority over ten cities.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the second came, saying, ‘Sir, your mina has made five minas.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said to this one also, ‘And you be over five cities.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And another came, saying, ‘Sir, behold your mina, which I had put away for safekeeping in a piece of cloth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I was afraid of you, because you are a severe man—you withdraw what you did not deposit, and you reap what you did not sow!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to him, ‘By your own words I will judge you, wicked slave! You knew that I am a severe man, withdrawing what I did not deposit and reaping what I did not sow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And why did you not give my money to the bank, and I, when I returned, would have collected it with interest?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And to the bystanders he said, ‘Take away from him the mina and give it to the one who has the ten minas!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said to him, ‘Sir, he has ten minas.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘I tell you that to everyone who has, more will be given. But from the one who does not have, even what he has will be taken away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But these enemies of mine who did not want me to be king over them—bring them here and slaughter them in my presence!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after he had said these things, he traveled on ahead, going up to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that when he drew near to Bethphage and Bethany, to the hill called the Mount of Olives, he sent two of the disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, ‘Go into the village in front of you, in which as you enter you will find a colt tied, on which no person has ever sat, and untie it and bring it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if anyone asks you, ‘Why are you untying it?’ you will say this: ‘The Lord has need of it.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So those who were sent went and found it just as he had told them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they were untying the colt, its owners said to them, ‘Why are you untying the colt?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they said, ‘The Lord has need of it.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they brought it to Jesus, and throwing their cloaks on the colt, they put Jesus on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he was going along, they were spreading out their cloaks on the road.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as he was drawing near by this time to the descent from the Mount of Olives, the whole crowd of the disciples began rejoicing to praise God with a loud voice for all the miracles that they had seen,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
saying,
“Blessed is the king,
    the one who comes in the name of the Lord!
Peace in heaven
    and glory in the highest!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some of the Pharisees from the crowd said to him, “Teacher, rebuke your disciples!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answered and said, “I tell you that if these keep silent, the stones will cry out!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he approached and saw the city, he wept over it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “If you had known on this day—even you—the things that make for peace! But now they are hidden from your eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For days will come upon you and your enemies will put up an embankment against you, and will surround you and press you hard from all directions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they will raze you to the ground, you and your children within you, and will not leave a stone upon a stone within you, because you did not recognize the time of your visitation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he entered into the temple courts and began to drive out those who were selling,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying to them, “It is written, ‘And my house will be a house of prayer,’ but you have made it a cave of robbers!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was teaching every day in the temple courts, and the chief priests and the scribes and the most prominent men of the people were seeking to destroy him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they did not find anything they could do, because all the people were paying close attention to what they were hearing from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that on one of the days while he was teaching the people in the temple courts and proclaiming the gospel, the chief priests and the scribes approached together with the elders
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, saying to him, “Tell us, by what authority you are doing these things, or who is the one who gave you this authority?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answered and said to them, “I also will ask you a question, and you tell me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The baptism of John—was it from heaven or from men?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they discussed this with one another, saying, “If we say ‘From heaven,’ he will say, ‘Why did you not believe him?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if we say, ‘From men,’ all the people will stone us to death, because they are convinced that John was a prophet.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they replied that they did not know where it was from.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to them, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I am doing these things.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he began to tell the people this parable: “A man planted a vineyard, and leased it to tenant farmers, and went on a journey for a long time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And at the proper time he sent a slave to the tenant farmers, so that they would give him some of the fruit of the vineyard. But the tenant farmers sent him away empty-handed after beating him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he proceeded to send another slave, but they beat and dishonored that one also, and sent him away empty-handed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he proceeded to send a third, but they wounded and threw out this one also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the owner of the vineyard said, ‘What should I do? I will send my beloved son; perhaps they will respect him.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the tenant farmers saw him, they began to reason with one another, saying, ‘This is the heir. Let us kill him so that the inheritance will become ours!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they threw him out of the vineyard and killed him. What then will the owner of the vineyard do to them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will come and destroy those tenant farmers and give the vineyard to others.” And when they heard this, they said, “May this never happen!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But he looked intently at them and said, “What then is this that is written:
‘The stone which the builders rejected,
    this has become the cornerstone.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone who falls on that stone will be broken to pieces, and the one on whom it falls—it will crush him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the scribes and the chief priests sought to lay their hands on him at that same hour, and they were afraid of the people, for they knew that he had told this parable with reference to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they watched him closely and sent spies who pretended they were upright, in order that they could catch him in a statement, so that they could hand him over to the authority and the jurisdiction of the governor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they asked him, saying, “Teacher, we know that you speak and teach rightly, and do not show partiality, but teach the way of God in truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is it permitted for us to pay taxes to Caesar or not?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But seeing through their craftiness, he said to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Show me a denarius! Whose image and inscription does it have?” And they answered and said, “Caesar’s.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said to them, “Well then, give to Caesar the things of Caesar, and to God the things of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were not able to catch him in a statement in the sight of the people, and astonished at his answer, they became silent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now some of the Sadducees—who deny that there is a resurrection—came up and asked him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “Teacher, Moses wrote for us if someone’s brother dies having a wife, and this man is childless, that his brother should take the wife and father descendants for his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there were seven brothers, and the first took a wife and died childless,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the second,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the third took her, and likewise also the seven did not leave children and died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Finally the woman also died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore in the resurrection, the woman—whose wife will she be? For the seven had her as wife.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to them, “The sons of this age marry and are given in marriage,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but those who are considered worthy to attain to that age and to the resurrection from the dead neither marry nor are given in marriage,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for they are not even able to die any longer, because they are like the angels and are sons of God, because they are sons of the resurrection.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But that the dead are raised, even Moses revealed in the passage about the bush, when he calls the Lord the God of Abraham and the God of Isaac and the God of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he is not God of the dead, but of the living, for all live to him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some of the scribes answered and said, “Teacher, you have spoken well.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they no longer dared to ask him anything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said to them, “In what sense do they say that the Christ is David’s son?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For David himself says in the book of Psalms,
‘The Lord said to my Lord,
    “Sit at my right hand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
until I make your enemies
    a footstool for your feet.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David therefore calls him ‘Lord,’ and how is he his son?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while all the people were listening, he said to the disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Beware of the scribes, who like walking around in long robes and who love greetings in the marketplaces and the best seats in the synagogues and the places of honor at banquets,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who devour the houses of widows and pray lengthy prayers for the sake of appearance. These will receive more severe condemnation!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he looked up and saw the rich putting their gifts into the contribution box,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he saw a certain poor widow putting in there two small copper coins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Truly I say to you that this poor widow put in more than all of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For these all put gifts into the offering out of their abundance, but this woman out of her poverty put in all the means of subsistence that she had.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while some were speaking about the temple, that it was adorned with precious stones and votive offerings, he said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As for these things that you see—days will come in which not one stone will be left on another stone that will not be thrown down!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they asked him, saying, “Teacher, when therefore will these things happen, and what will be the sign when these things are about to take place?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, Watch out that you are not deceived! For many will come in my name, saying, ‘I am he,’ and ‘The time is near!’ Do not go after them!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when you hear about wars and insurrections, do not be terrified, for these things must happen first, but the end will not be at once.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to them, “nation will rise up against nation and kingdom against kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There will be great earthquakes and famines and plagues in various places. There will be terrible sights and great signs from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But before all these things, they will lay their hands on you and will persecute you, handing you over to the synagogues and prisons. You will be brought before kings and governors because of my name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This will turn out to you for a time of witness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore make up your minds not to prepare in advance to speak in your own defense,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I will give you a mouth and wisdom that all your opponents will not be able to resist or contradict.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you will be handed over even by parents and brothers and relatives and friends, and they will put to death some of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you will be hated by all because of my name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even a hair of your head will never perish!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By your patient endurance you will gain your lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But when you see Jerusalem surrounded by armies, then know that its desolation has come near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then those in Judea must flee to the mountains, and those inside it must depart, and those in the fields must not enter into it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because these are days of vengeance, so that all the things that are written can be fulfilled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe to those who are pregnant and to those who are nursing their babies in those days! For there will be great distress on the earth and wrath against this people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they will fall by the edge of the sword, and will be led captive into all the nations, and Jerusalem will be trampled down by the Gentiles until the times of the Gentiles are fulfilled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And there will be signs in the sun and moon and stars, and on the earth distress of nations in perplexity from the noise of the sea and its surging,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: people fainting from fear and expectation of what is coming on the inhabited earth, for the powers of the heavens will be shaken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And then they will see the Son of Man arriving in a cloud with power and great glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when these things begin to happen, stand up straight and raise your heads, because your redemption is drawing near!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he told them a parable: “Look at the fig tree and all the trees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they put out foliage, now you see for yourselves and know that by this time the summer is near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So also you, when you see these things happening, know that the kingdom of God is near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly I say to you that this generation will never pass away until all things take place!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will never pass away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But take care for yourselves, lest your hearts are weighed down with dissipation and drunkenness and the worries of daily life, and that day come upon you suddenly
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: like a trap. For it will come upon all who reside on the face of the whole earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But be alert at all times, praying that you may have strength to escape all these things that are going to happen, and to stand before the Son of Man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So throughout the days he was teaching in the temple courts, and throughout the nights he was going out and spending the night on the hill that is called the Mount of Olives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the people were getting up very early in the morning to come to him in the temple courts to listen to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the feast of Unleavened Bread (which is called Passover) was drawing near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the chief priests and the scribes were seeking how they could destroy him, because they were afraid of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Satan entered into Judas, the one called Iscariot, who was of the number of the twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went away and discussed with the chief priests and officers of the temple guard how he could betray him to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were delighted, and came to an agreement with him to give him money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he agreed, and began looking for a favorable opportunity to betray him to them apart from the crowd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the day of the feast of Unleavened Bread came, on which it was necessary for the Passover lamb to be sacrificed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he sent Peter and John, saying, “Go and prepare the Passover for us, so that we may eat it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they said to him, “Where do you want us to prepare it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Behold, when you have entered into the city, a man carrying a jar of water will meet you. Follow him into the house which he enters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you will say to the master of the house, ‘The Teacher says to you, “Where is the guest room where I may eat the Passover with my disciples?”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he will show you a large furnished upstairs room. Make preparations there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they went and found everything just as he had told them, and they prepared the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the hour came, he reclined at the table, and the apostles with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “I have earnestly desired to eat this Passover with you before I suffer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I tell you that I will not eat it until it is fulfilled in the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took in hand a cup, and after giving thanks he said, “Take this and share it among yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I tell you, from now on I will not drink of the product of the vine until the kingdom of God comes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took bread, and after giving thanks, he broke it and gave it to them, saying, “This is my body which is given for you. Do this in remembrance of me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the same way the cup after they had eaten, saying, “This cup is the new covenant in my blood which is poured out for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But behold, the hand of the one who is betraying me is with me on the table!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Son of Man is going according to what has been determined, but woe to that man by whom he is betrayed!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they began to debate with one another who then of them it could be who was going to do this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a dispute also occurred among them as to which of them was recognized as being greatest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said to them, “The kings of the Gentiles lord it over them, and those who have authority over them are called benefactors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you are not to be like this! But the one who is greatest among you must become like the youngest, and the one who leads like the one who serves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For who is greater, the one who reclines at the table or the one who serves? Is it not the one who reclines at the table? But I am in your midst as the one who serves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And you are the ones who have remained with me in my trials,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I confer on you a kingdom, just as my Father conferred on me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that you may eat and drink at my table in my kingdom, and you will sit on thrones judging the twelve tribes of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Simon, Simon, behold, Satan has demanded to sift you like wheat,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but I have prayed for you, that your faith may not fail. And you, when once you have turned back, strengthen your brothers.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said to him, “Lord, I am ready to go with you both to prison and to death!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “I tell you, Peter, the rooster will not crow today until you have denied three times that you know me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “When I sent you out without a money bag and a traveler’s bag and sandals, you did not lack anything, did you?” And they said, “Nothing.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “But now the one who has a money bag must take it, and likewise a traveler’s bag. And the one who does not have a sword must sell his cloak and buy one.
verses.speaker: Narrator
