verses.text: For I tell you that this that is written must be fulfilled in me: ‘And he was counted with the criminals.’ For indeed, what is written about me is being fulfilled.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they said, “Lord, behold, here are two swords!” And he said to them, “It is adequate.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went away and proceeded, according to his custom, to the Mount of Olives, and the disciples also followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he came to the place, he said to them, “Pray that you will not enter into temptation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he withdrew from them about a stone’s throw and knelt down and began to pray,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “Father, if you are willing, take away this cup from me. Nevertheless, not my will but yours be done.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And an angel from heaven appeared to him, strengthening him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And being in anguish, he began praying more fervently and his sweat became like drops of blood falling down to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he got up from the prayer and came to the disciples, he found them sleeping from sorrow,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said to them, “Why are you sleeping? Get up and pray that you will not enter into temptation!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was still speaking, behold, there came a crowd, and the one named Judas, one of the twelve, leading them. And he approached Jesus to kiss him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said to him, “Judas, are you betraying the Son of Man with a kiss?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when those around him saw what was about to happen, they said, “Lord, should we strike with the sword?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a certain one of them struck the slave of the high priest and cut off his right ear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus answered and said, “Stop! No more of this!” And he touched his ear and healed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to the chief priests and officers of the temple and elders who had come out against him, “Have you come out with swords and clubs, as against a robber?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every day when I was with you in the temple courts, you did not stretch out your hands against me! But this is your hour and the domain of darkness!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they arrested him and led him away and brought him into the house of the high priest. But Peter was following at a distance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had kindled a fire in the middle of the courtyard and sat down together, Peter sat down among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a certain female slave, seeing him sitting in the light and looking intently at him, said, “This man also was with him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he denied it, saying, “Woman, I do not know him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after a short time another person saw him and said, “You also are one of them!” But Peter said, “Man, I am not!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after about one hour had passed, someone else was insisting, saying, “In truth this man also was with him, because he is also a Galilean!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter said, “Man, I do not know what you are talking about!” And immediately, while he was still speaking, a rooster crowed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord turned around and looked intently at Peter. And Peter remembered the word of the Lord, how he said to him, “Before the rooster crows today, you will deny me three times.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went outside and wept bitterly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the men who were guarding him began to mock him while they beat him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and after blindfolding him they repeatedly asked him, saying, “Prophesy! Who is the one who struck you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were saying many other things against him, reviling him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when day came, the council of elders of the people gathered, both chief priests and scribes, and they led him away to their Sanhedrin,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “If you are the Christ, tell us!” But he said to them, “If I tell you, you will never believe,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if I ask you, you will never answer!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But from now on the Son of Man will be seated at the right hand of the power of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they all said, “Are you then the Son of God?” And he said to them, “You say that I am.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, “Why do we have need of further testimony? For we ourselves have heard it from his mouth!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the whole assembly of them rose up and brought him before Pilate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they began to accuse him, saying, “We have found this man misleading our nation and forbidding us to pay taxes to Caesar, and saying he himself is Christ, a king!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pilate asked him, saying, “Are you the king of the Jews?” And he answered him and said, “You say so.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Pilate said to the chief priests and the crowds, “I find no basis for an accusation against this man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they insisted, saying, “He incites the people, teaching throughout the whole of Judea and beginning from Galilee as far as here.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Pilate heard this, he asked if the man was a Galilean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he found out that he was from the jurisdiction of Herod, he sent him over to Herod, who was also in Jerusalem in those days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Herod saw Jesus, he was very glad, for he had been wanting to see him for a long time, because he had heard about him and was hoping to see some miracle performed by him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he questioned him at considerable length, but he answered nothing to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the chief priests and the scribes were standing there vehemently accusing him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Herod with his soldiers also treated him with contempt, and after mocking him and dressing him in glistening clothing, he sent him back to Pilate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And both Herod and Pilate became friends with one another on that same day, for they had previously been enemies of one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Pilate called together the chief priests and the rulers and the people
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to them, “You brought me this man as one who was misleading the people, and behold, when I examined him before you, I found nothing in this man as basis for the accusation which you are making against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But neither did Herod, because he sent him back to us. And behold, nothing deserving death has been done by him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I will punish him and release him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they all cried out in unison, saying, “Take this man away, and release for us Barabbas!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (who had been thrown in prison because of a certain insurrection that had taken place in the city, and for murder).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pilate, wanting to release Jesus, addressed them again,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but they kept crying out, saying, “Crucify! Crucify him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said to them a third time, “Why? What wrong has this man done? I found no basis for an accusation deserving death in him. Therefore I will punish him and release him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they were urgent, demanding with loud cries that he be crucified. And their cries prevailed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pilate decided that their demand should be granted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he released the one who had been thrown into prison because of insurrection and murder, whom they were asking for, but Jesus he handed over to their will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they led him away, they seized Simon, a certain man of Cyrene, who was coming from the country, and placed the cross on him, to carry it behind Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a great crowd of the people were following him, and of women who were mourning and lamenting him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But turning to them, Jesus said, “Daughters of Jerusalem, do not weep for me, but weep for yourselves and for your children!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For behold, days are coming in which they will say, ‘Blessed are the barren, and the wombs that did not give birth, and the breasts that did not nurse!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they will begin to say to the mountains, ‘Fall on us!’ and to the hills, ‘Cover us!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if they do these things when the wood is green, what will happen when it is dry?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And two other criminals were also led away to be executed with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they came to the place that is called “The Skull,” there they crucified him, and the criminals, the one on his right and the other on his left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said, “Father, forgive them, for they do not know what they are doing.” And they cast lots to divide his clothes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people stood there watching, but the rulers also ridiculed him, saying, “He saved others; let him save himself, if this man is the Christ of God, the Chosen One!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the soldiers also mocked him, coming up and offering him sour wine
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and saying, “If you are the king of the Jews, save yourself!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was also an inscription over him, “This is the king of the Jews.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one of the criminals who were hanged there reviled him, saying, “Are you not the Christ? Save yourself—and us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the other answered and rebuked him, saying, “Do you not even fear God, because you are undergoing the same condemnation?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we indeed justly, for we are receiving what we deserve for what we have done. But this man has done nothing wrong!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Jesus, remember me when you come into your kingdom!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to him, “Truly I say to you, today you will be with me in paradise.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And by this time it was about the sixth hour, and darkness came over the whole land until the ninth hour
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because the light of the sun failed. And the curtain of the temple was torn apart down the middle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus, calling out with a loud voice, said, “Father, into your hands I entrust my spirit!” And after he said this, he expired.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the centurion saw what had happened, he began to praise God, saying, “Certainly this man was righteous!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the crowds that had come together for this spectacle, when they saw the things that had happened, returned home beating their breasts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all his acquaintances, and the women who had followed him from Galilee who saw these things, stood at a distance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, a man named Joseph, who was a member of the council, a good and righteous man
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (this man was not consenting to their plan and deed), from Arimathea, a Judean town, who was looking forward to the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This man approached Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took it down and wrapped it in a linen cloth and placed him in a tomb cut into the rock where no one had ever been placed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it was the day of preparation, and the Sabbath was drawing near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the women who had been accompanying him from Galilee followed and saw the tomb and how his body was placed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they returned and prepared fragrant spices and perfumes, and on the Sabbath they rested according to the commandment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now on the first day of the week, at very early dawn, they came back to the tomb bringing the fragrant spices which they had prepared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they found the stone had been rolled away from the tomb,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but when they went in, they did not find the body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that while they were perplexed about this, behold, two men in gleaming clothing stood near them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they were terrified and bowed their faces to the ground, they said to them, “Why are you looking for the living among the dead?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is not here, but has been raised! Remember how he spoke to you while he was still in Galilee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying that the Son of Man must be delivered into the hands of men who are sinners, and be crucified, and on the third day rise?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they remembered his words,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when they returned from the tomb, they reported all these things to the eleven and to all the rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Mary Magdalene and Joanna and Mary the mother of James and the others with them were telling these things to the apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these words appeared to them as nonsense, and they refused to believe them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter got up and ran to the tomb, and bending over to look, he saw only the strips of linen cloth, and he went away to his home wondering what had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, on that same day, two of them were traveling to a village named Emmaus that was sixty stadia distant from Jerusalem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they were conversing with one another about all these things that had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that while they were conversing, and discussing, Jesus himself also approached and began to go along with them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but their eyes were prevented from recognizing him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “What are these matters that you are discussing with one another as you are walking along?” And they stood still, looking sad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one of them, named Cleopas, answered and said to him, “Are you the only one living near Jerusalem and not knowing the things that have happened in it in these days?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “What things?” So they said to him, “The things concerning Jesus the Nazarene, a man who was a prophet, powerful in deed and word before God and all the people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and how our chief priests and rulers handed him over to a sentence of death, and crucified him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we were hoping that he was the one who was going to redeem Israel. But in addition to all these things, this is the third day since these things took place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But also some women from among us astonished us, who were at the tomb early in the morning,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when they did not find his body, they came back saying they had seen even a vision of angels, who said that he was alive!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some of those with us went out to the tomb and found it like this, just as the women had also said, but him they did not see.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “O foolish and slow in heart to believe in all that the prophets have spoken!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Was it not necessary that the Christ suffer these things and enter into his glory?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And beginning from Moses and from all the prophets, he interpreted to them the things concerning himself in all the scriptures.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they drew near to the village where they were going, and he acted as though he was going farther.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they urged him strongly, saying, “Stay with us, because it is getting toward evening, and by this time the day is far spent.” And he went in to stay with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that when he reclined at the table with them, he took the bread and gave thanks, and after breaking it, he gave it to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And their eyes were opened, and they recognized him, and he became invisible to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said to one another, “Were not our hearts burning within us while he was speaking with us on the road, while he was explaining the scriptures to us?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they got up that same hour and returned to Jerusalem and found the eleven and those with them assembled,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “The Lord has really been raised, and has appeared to Simon!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they began describing what happened on the road, and how he was recognized by them in the breaking of the bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while they were saying these things, he himself stood there among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they were startled and became terrified, and thought they had seen a ghost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Why are you frightened? And for what reason do doubts arise in your hearts?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look at my hands and my feet, that I am I myself! Touch me and see, because a ghost does not have flesh and bones, as you see that I have.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had said this, he showed them his hands and his feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while they were still disbelieving because of joy and were marveling, he said to them, “Do you have anything to eat here?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they gave him a piece of broiled fish,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he took it and ate it in front of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “These are my words that I spoke to you while I was still with you, that everything that is written about me in the law of Moses and the prophets and psalms must be fulfilled.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he opened their minds to understand the scriptures,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to them, “Thus it is written that the Christ would suffer and would rise from the dead on the third day,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and repentance and the forgiveness of sins would be proclaimed in his name to all the nations, beginning from Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are witnesses of these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, I am sending out what was promised by my Father upon you, but you stay in the city until you are clothed with power from on high.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he led them out as far as Bethany, and lifting up his hands, he blessed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that while he was blessing them, he parted from them and was taken up into heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they worshiped him and returned to Jerusalem with great joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were continually in the temple courts praising God.
verses.speaker: Narrator
